thread.title: Lena Dunham says Donald Trump caused her to lose weight because the election made her too upset to eat
thread.title_full: Lena Dunham says Donald Trump caused her to lose weight because the election made her too upset to eat

author: Helena Horton
title: Lena Dunham says Donald Trump caused her to lose weight because the election made her too upset to eat
text:
Lena Dunham says Donald Trump caused her to lose weight because the election made her too upset to eat Lena Dunham is on the 'Donald Trump diet' Credit: Startraks Photo/REX/Shutterstock Helena Horton  48am 
L ena Dunham has claimed the US election caused her to lose weight, because Donald Trump winning made her too upset to eat. 
The star, who once said she would leave the country if Mr Trump won the election, has claimed many have asked her about her shrinking waistline. 
She revealed her secret to SiriusSM Radio: "Everyone’s been asking like, 'What have you been doing?' 
"And I’m like, 'Try soul-crushing pain and devastation and hopelessness and you, too, will lose weight.'" Unfollowed @POTUS , followed @KamalaHarris , because women are the future of our party. #MuteMonday — Lena Dunham (@lenadunham) January 23, 2017 
M s Dunham was on the show to talk about her television series, Girls, but the conversation soon turned to the President. 
She said: "He said I was a B-list actor with no mojo". 
The actress and writer was also asked whether it would be a mistake for Donald Trump to listen to celebrities like her. 
Ms Dunham replied: "Here’s the funny thing. Of course, it’s a mistake. Watch | Celebrities lampoon Trump and back Clinton at DNC 01:56 
"But we’re talking about him like he’s a person who is operating in a sane way, we’re talking about him like a person who doesn’t have a personality disorder." 
W hen asked why she didn't move to Canada after Donald Trump became President, the celebrity explained she never thought he would win. 
She said that at the time, a Trump win seemed like an "impossible joke" that "would never happen. I was like, the most qualified candidate we’ve ever had is running against a steak salesman. We’re going to be fine".
